args.justification: After splitting its members into more specific classes, the original class should be clearly marked as a legacy aggregate and aligned to the same butterfly-focused class group.

args.new_description: Adult butterflies as whole organisms, regardless of sex, representing the adult life stage of butterflies.
args.justification: The new split class representing all adult butterflies should be given a clean canonical name and attached to the butterfly-focused class group.

args.new_description: Adult butterflies of the female sex that lay eggs on specific host plants to begin the next generation.
args.justification: The sex-specific subset of adult butterflies merits its own organism class and should be aligned under the same butterfly biology class group.
Butterfly egg size, shape, and color are intrinsic traits within the same biological domain as the other butterfly-related classes and should share a common 'Butterfly Biology' class group.

args.new_description: Taxonomic species of butterflies and their caterpillar (larval) stages, used to explain variation in traits such as shape, color, and lifespan.
args.justification: This class represents species-level taxa for butterflies and caterpillars; renaming and setting class_type_hint to 'Taxon' clarifies its scope while attaching it to the shared 'Butterfly Biology' class group.

executed_decisions.justification: The original 'Adult Butterflies' class bundles a general organism concept and a sex-specific subset ('female butterflies'); splitting yields two more coherent organism classes.

cluster_classes.class_description: Anatomical wing structures of butterflies, including their distinct post-emergence physical states prior to functional flight.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: wings of a butterfly… initial post-emergence state of a butterfly’s wings

members.entity_description: The flight-enabling appendages of a butterfly that develop during metamorphosis and must expand and harden before enabling flight.
The initial post-emergence state of a butterfly’s wings, when they are soft and wrinkled before expansion and hardening.

cluster_classes.class_description: Physiological and behavioral processes that occur as a butterfly transitions from chrysalis to functional adult, culminating in flight.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: pumping fluid into wings to expand and harden… ready to take flight for the first time

members.entity_description: Process by which a butterfly circulates fluid into its wings to expand and harden them.
The initial act of flying that a butterfly performs after its wings develop.

cluster_classes.class_description: Biological processes and outcomes involved in a caterpillar’s transformation into an adult butterfly, including specific metamorphosis and broader developmental changes.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Transformation of a caterpillar inside the chrysalis into an adult butterfly, described as astonishing transformations.

members.entity_description: Transformation process in which a caterpillar's body reorganizes inside the chrysalis and develops into an adult butterfly.
Adult form that the caterpillar develops into after completing metamorphosis.
Remarkable morphological and developmental changes occurring across butterfly life stages.

args.name: Adult Butterfly Organism
args.description: The adult butterfly as an organism, representing the outcome of metamorphosis rather than the developmental process itself.
args.justification: En_328200c3 is an organism outcome distinct from the developmental processes in 'Butterfly Development', so it should be modeled as its own organism class rather than mixed into a process class.
The entity 'butterfly' (En_328200c3) is the adult organism, not a process, so it fits better in the newly created organism class than in the 'Butterfly Development' process class.

args.new_description: Anatomical wing structures of butterflies, including their initial post-emergence physical states prior to functional flight.
args.justification: This class correctly covers anatomical wing structures and states; only a stable, shared Class_Group is needed to align it with related metamorphosis and emergence classes.

args.new_description: Physiological and behavioral processes as a butterfly transitions from chrysalis to functional adult, including wing expansion and first flight.
args.justification: This class focuses on specific emergence-stage processes within the butterfly life cycle and should share a Class_Group with other metamorphosis-related classes.

args.new_description: Biological processes involved in a caterpillar's transformation into an adult butterfly, including metamorphosis and broader morphological transformations, excluding the adult organism itself.
args.justification: After moving the adult organism entity out, this class should be clearly scoped to developmental processes and aligned via a shared Class_Group with related emergence and anatomical classes.

args.new_description: The adult butterfly as an organism, representing the endpoint of the metamorphosis process.
args.justification: The new organism class should be explicitly connected to the same life-cycle Class_Group as the related developmental and emergence process classes.

cluster_classes.class_description: Developmental stages of a butterfly from overall life cycle to specific later stages, including the pupa (chrysalis) and adult phases.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: All entities describe the butterfly life cycle or specific life stages (pupa/chrysalis, adult).

members.entity_description: The full developmental sequence or journey of a butterfly from egg through larval and pupal stages to the adult form, recurring across generations.

members.entity_name: pupa stage of the butterfly life cycle
members.entity_description: The third developmental stage of a butterfly, in which the organism becomes a pupa enclosed in a chrysalis and undergoes metamorphosis from larva to adult.
The fourth and final life cycle stage of a butterfly, when the fully developed adult butterfly emerges from the chrysalis, flies, feeds, mates, and reproduces.

cluster_classes.class_description: Processes in adult butterflies related to securing mates and producing offspring, including mating behavior and the act of reproduction itself.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Throughout their adult stage, butterflies focus on finding a mate and reproducing to continue the life cycle.

members.entity_description: The activity of butterflies seeking and finding mates during the adult stage.
The process by which adult butterflies produce offspring, continuing the life cycle.

args.new_description: Developmental stages of a butterfly from egg through larval and pupal stages to the adult form, including references to specific later stages such as the pupa (chrysalis) and adult phases.
args.justification: This class consistently models developmental stages of butterflies (overall life cycle, pupa, adult); it should remain distinct but be grouped with reproductive processes under a shared Class_Group for butterfly ontogeny and reproduction.

args.new_description: Processes in adult butterflies related to securing mates and producing offspring, including mating behavior and the act of reproduction itself, which occur during the adult stage of the life cycle.
args.justification: This class focuses on mating and reproduction in butterflies, which is a distinct process domain but tightly coupled to the adult life stage; assigning it to the same Class_Group as the life cycle class connects developmental stages with the associated reproductive processes without conflating them.

executed_decisions.new_description: Developmental stages of a butterfly from egg through larval and pupal stages to the adult form, including references to specific later stages such as the pupa (chrysalis) and adult phases.

cluster_classes.class_description: Life stages and experiential states of the butterfly as an adult, from immediate post-emergence to mature, graceful flight.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: newly emerged adult butterfly… moment of beauty and grace in flight

members.entity_description: An adult butterfly immediately after leaving the chrysalis, before its wings have fully expanded and hardened.
The perceived aesthetic state of an adult butterfly in flight, characterized as beautiful and graceful.

cluster_classes.class_description: Concepts describing the adult stage of butterflies and its temporal characteristics, including the winged, reproductive form and how long this stage lasts.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Adult butterflies as the final life stage and the duration of the adult stage.

members.entity_description: The fourth and final life stage of butterflies, when they are winged, sexually mature insects that feed (often on nectar), pollinate, and focus on mating and reproduction, typically living from a few days to a few weeks depending on species.
The duration of the adult stage of a butterfly's life, typically from a few days to a few weeks depending on species.

cluster_classes.class_description: Distinct developmental stages in the butterfly life cycle, from egg to larval caterpillar, treated as organismal life stages rather than specific anatomical parts.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: egg life stage and larval life stage (caterpillar) within the butterfly life cycle

members.entity_description: The initial life stage of a butterfly during which the organism exists as eggs laid on host plants before hatching into larvae (caterpillars), with eggs varying in size, shape, and color by species.
The larval life stage of butterflies, beginning when the egg hatches into a caterpillar and encompassing the primary feeding, rapid growth, and preparation for pupation.

splits.name: Newly emerged adult butterfly stage
splits.description: The specific early part of the adult butterfly life stage immediately after emergence from the chrysalis, before the wings have fully expanded and hardened.

splits.name: Butterfly aesthetic state in flight
splits.description: The perceived aesthetic or experiential state of an adult butterfly in flight, characterized as beautiful and graceful, independent of its biological life stage.

args.justification: ClsC_dc523bae mixes a concrete biological life stage (newly emerged adult) with a non-biological aesthetic/experiential state in flight, so it should be split into a life-stage class and an aesthetic-state class.

args.new_description: The adult, winged life stage of butterflies, including the newly emerged adult immediately post-eclosion as well as the general sexually mature, reproductive adult phase and its typical lifespan.
args.justification: ClsC_7706dd85 and the split class ClsC_dc523bae_AdultStage both describe the adult butterfly life stage (general adult form, lifespan, and immediate post-emergence period), so they form a single coherent adult-life-stage concept.

args.new_description: The adult, winged life stage of butterflies, from immediate post-emergence from the chrysalis through the sexually mature, reproductive period, including typical duration of the adult phase.
args.justification: The merged adult-stage class should be clearly labeled as a butterfly life stage and grouped under a broader 'Butterfly Life Cycle' Class_Group for consistency with other life-stage classes.

ClsC_9205413b already represents egg and larval stages of butterflies, so assigning it to the same 'Butterfly Life Cycle' Class_Group as the adult-stage class unifies all biological life stages within one lifecycle grouping.

args.new_description: The perceived aesthetic or experiential state of a butterfly in flight (e.g., beauty, grace), modeled as a phenomenological state rather than a biological life stage.
args.justification: The aesthetic perception of a butterfly in flight is not a life stage but a phenomenological state, so it should have its own clear label and be grouped separately from biological life-cycle classes.

cluster_classes.class_description: Behaviors of caterpillars related to consuming plant leaves as their primary nutritional activity.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Caterpillars feeding on plant leaves as their main activity and food source.

members.entity_description: Primary caterpillar activity of consuming plant leaves for nutrition.
Plant leaves that serve as sites for egg-laying, feeding by caterpillars, and attachment for chrysalis formation.

splits.name: Caterpillar Plant-Leaf Substrate
splits.description: Plant leaves serving as physical substrate for caterpillar egg-laying, feeding, and chrysalis attachment.

args.justification: The original class mixes a behavior entity ('feeding on leaves') with an environmental/location entity ('plant leaves'); splitting separates behavior from physical substrate.

args.new_description: Behaviors of caterpillars specifically related to consuming plant leaves as a primary food source.
args.justification: After removing the substrate entity, the remaining entity is purely behavioral; updating the name/description clarifies scope and assigns an appropriate shared Class_Group.

args.new_description: Plant leaves considered as physical structures used by caterpillars for egg-laying, feeding sites, and chrysalis attachment.
args.justification: The new split class is environmental rather than behavioral; setting a clear name, description, type hint, and aligning its Class_Group with the related behavior class makes the schema coherent.
